name: Muslim Community Network
mission: We are dedicated to using civic education and leadership development to shape the public narrative about what it means to be Muslim in America.

geographicCoverage: New York City (New York, United States)
Brooklyn (Kings County, New York, United States)

theoryOfChange: Equipping community leaders and service providers with cultural competency and safety tools leads to safer, stronger, and more civically engaged communities.

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.improvement_suggestion: Clarify zakat allocation policy and eligible use categories for donors.

alignment.rationale: Alignment 28/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

score_details.score_summary: MCN shows strong impact and good alignment, with zakat compliance. Evidence score may reflect limited reporting capacity, not program weakness.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://mcnny.org/donate (Source: https://mcnny.org/donate)

all_citations.claim: MCN reported total revenue of $768,698 and operates programs in youth leadership and civic engagement.
The organization is zakat-eligible and accepts donations under specific asnaf categories.
MCN provides multiple giving methods for donors to support its mission.
MCN holds a 98.0/100 score with a 72.9% program expense ratio, 8.2 months of working capital, and a fundraising efficiency of $0.05 per $1 raised.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: MCN earns a moderate overall score reflecting high financial transparency and accountability, balanced by a medium alignment score for specific donor segments.
areas_for_improvement: program expense ratio of 72.9% is healthy but has room for growth toward industry-leading benchmarks
Limited public data on specific cost-per-beneficiary metrics

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization offers a medium fit for donors, focusing on religious and cultural cause urgency through civic empowerment [4]. Its zakat-eligible status provides a clear pathway for Muslim donors to support community leadership initiatives [2][3].
dimension_explanations.impact: MCN demonstrates high capacity-building effectiveness by allocating 72.9% of its $768,698 total revenue directly to its core programs [1][4]. The organization maintains a high level of financial health and transparency, evidenced by its 98.0/100 rating from Charity Navigator [4].

baseline_narrative.headline: MCN empowers the American Muslim community through civic education and leadership development to reshape public narratives.
strengths: High financial accountability with a Charity Navigator score of 98.0/100
Strong fundraising efficiency, spending only $0.05 to raise every $1
Robust liquidity with 8.2 months of working capital
baseline_narrative.summary: MCN is a non-profit organization dedicated to shaping the public narrative of Muslims in America through youth leadership, community education, and civic engagement [1]. The organization is recognized as zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations through its various social and educational programs [2].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: MCN earns a moderate overall score reflecting high financial transparency and accountability, balanced by a medium alignment score for specific donor segments.

areas_for_improvement.context: While MCN tracks <cite id="13">three outcome metrics via Candid</cite>, there is <cite id="14">no publicly available beneficiary count</cite> to determine cost-per-beneficiary efficiency.
Although MCN <cite id="15">accepts Zakat across eight categories</cite>, providing a more detailed allocation policy would help donors understand the specific distribution of these funds.

bbb_assessment.summary: MCN has not yet been formally evaluated against the 20 BBB Wise Giving Alliance standards.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization is actively tracking metrics through Candid and maintains high financial transparency to offset data gaps.
risk_factors: <cite id="18">Theory of change is still in the developing stage</cite>
case_against.summary: The primary limitation is the <cite id="14">lack of granular impact data</cite> and external evaluations.

confidence.notes: Strong financial and governance data available; impact data is self-reported.

alignment.explanation: MCN is a strong fit for Muslim donors, offering <cite id="15">Zakat-eligible programs</cite> that serve the <cite id="15">fuqara, masakin, and other eligible categories</cite>.
alignment.improvement: MCN could improve alignment by <cite id="19">clarifying its specific Zakat allocation policies</cite> for each of the eight categories it serves.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust MCN due to its <cite id="7">Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite> and <cite id="12">83% independent board</cite>. The organization has a <cite id="16">18-year track record</cite> of service in New York.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, MCN could <cite id="17">seek a formal BBB Wise Giving Alliance review</cite> to meet all 20 standards of accountability.

impact.explanation: MCN operates with a <cite id="4">72.9% program ratio</cite> and maintains <cite id="11">resilient working capital</cite>. Its model focuses on <cite id="5">capacity building and civic education</cite>.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="14">publishing consistent beneficiary counts</cite> and documenting a more <cite id="18">explicit theory of change</cite>.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Internal outcome tracking via Candid

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct program implementation rather than grantmaking

rich_narrative.headline: MCN empowers the American Muslim community through civic education and leadership development to reshape public narratives.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support the long-term civic integration and leadership of Muslims in America through a highly transparent, New York-based institution.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill Zakat through civic and social programs
Value high financial accountability and transparency ratings
Care about Muslim representation in the American public narrative
Prefer supporting established organizations with deep local roots
giving_considerations: Gifts support capacity building rather than just emergency relief
The organization has a strong financial cushion, ensuring long-term viability
Impact is measured through leadership development rather than simple headcounts
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking international emergency relief or those who require rigorous third-party Randomized Controlled Trials (RCTs) for impact evidence.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects that the organization <cite id="13">tracks internal outcome metrics</cite> but lacks <cite id="14">independent external evaluations</cite>.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: MCN creates impact by training Muslim youth and leaders to engage in civic life, thereby shifting public perception and policy.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that civic education programs are effectively moving the needle on community engagement and narrative change.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: As a mid-sized organization in a high-cost area (NYC), MCN has significant capacity to scale its leadership academies.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its <cite id="11">exceptionally high working capital (13 months)</cite> compared to smaller community nonprofits.

similar_organizations.differentiator: More focus on direct social services and health
similar_organizations.name: Inner City Muslim Action Network

similar_organizations.differentiator: Focus on interfaith education and curriculum
similar_organizations.name: Islamic Networks Group

strengths.detail: MCN maintains an <cite id="8">overall score of 98.0/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>, driven by a <cite id="9">98/100 accountability rating</cite> and strong governance practices.
The organization demonstrates lean operations, spending only <cite id="10">$0.05 to raise every $1</cite> in contributions.
MCN holds <cite id="11">8.2 months of working capital</cite>, providing a significant buffer for long-term program stability.

strengths_deep_dive: MCN's financial health is characterized by high liquidity and low overhead. With <cite id="11">8.2 months of working capital</cite> held in reserve, the organization is well-positioned to weather economic fluctuations. Their <cite id="4">72.9% program expense ratio</cite> exceeds many peer organizations in the civic engagement space. Furthermore, the organization is led by <cite id="12">independent board members who make up 83% of the board</cite>, ensuring objective oversight of its <cite id="3">$768,698 annual budget</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: The Muslim Community Network (MCN) is a New York-based organization dedicated to <cite id="1">shaping the public narrative about what it means to be Muslim in America</cite> through civic education and leadership development. Operating primarily in <cite id="2">New York City and Brooklyn</cite>, MCN addresses the need for Muslim representation in the public sphere while providing direct community services. The organization reported <cite id="3">$768,698 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year, maintaining a <cite id="4">program expense ratio of 72.9%</cite>. This high level of efficiency ensures that the vast majority of donor contributions directly support initiatives like the <cite id="5">MCN Impact Academy and the Immigration Project</cite>. Beyond civic engagement, MCN operates a <cite id="6">Zakat Fund and a Food Drive/Soup Kitchen</cite>, bridging the gap between faith-based obligations and social service. The organization is recognized for its transparency, holding a <cite id="7">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite> and an <cite id="8">overall score of 98.0/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>.
